title: South Africa GDP Q2 2019 - Sector breakdown
text:
SA GDP Growth QoQ

Mining and Quarry - added 1.0%

Finance - added 0.9%

Trade - added 0.5%

Government services - added 0.5%

Agriculture - detracted -0.1%

Construction - detracted -0.1%

Sector Breakdown - Contribution to GDP

Gross Fixed Capital Formation

Agriculture

Construction

Transport

Growth Sectors

It has been widely reported that the South African economy grew by an annualised 3.1% in the 2nd quarter of 2019. This after a -3.1% contraction in the 1st quarter. This was an impressive quarter, beating the expected growth rate of 2.5% comfortably - in fact this was the strongest quarter since Q4 2017.Focusing on the contribution to GDP at a sector level, we saw strong performances from:On the negative side:This should not come as a surprise. Agriculture has been hit by one of the worst droughts in recent history, while also battling with policy uncertainty. The construction sector has had weak economic growth and limited infrastructure spending to deal with.Gross Fixed Capital Formation increased for the first time since Q4 2017. This thanks to the strong imports of machinery and equipment. In other words, companies are investing. This is not enough to say there is a change in trend. It could just be that companies are replacing old machines, but at least it's a positive.If we go back to the sectors, the following sectors are currently in a recession in South Africa: Agriculture, Construction and Transport.Our 2 most resilient sectors: Finance and Personal Services, have gone at least 35 quarters without seeing any contraction.
